thread.title: The Wall Street Journal: Kraft Heinz hints at appetite for deals

title: The Wall Street Journal: Kraft Heinz hints at appetite for deals
text:
45 a.m. ET Share 
Investor presentation notes industry consolidation pressure amid changing consumer trends Getty Images JP Morgan analyst Ken Goldman said Kraft Heinz’s surprise presentation on Thursday could be a public relations effort to shed negative perceptions ahead of another takeover approach. 
By Annie Gasparro 
Kraft Heinz Co. on Thursday hinted at plans to do more deals. 
In a presentation to investors, Chief Executive Bernardo Hees said big food makers like Kraft KHC, -4.60% face pressure to consolidate to confront changing consumer demands for fresher food and more snacks. ‘With our global presence and financial strength, I think that we’ll continue to generate opportunities for us to expand our portfolio.’ Chief Executive Bernardo Hees 
The narrated slideshow, released a day before Kraft Heinz reported earnings , touts the company’s plans to expand globally and efforts to boost sales of brands like Philadelphia cream cheese and Planters nuts. 
Kraft Heinz, which is run by executives from Brazilian investment firm 3G Capital LLC, has earned a reputation for its efficiency. Less than three years after its merger, Kraft Heinz has stripped $1.7 billion from annual spending—$200 million more than executives initially expected—through measures such as closing factories and cutting back on executive travel. As a result, Kraft Heinz’s profitability has soared.
